title: Job Openings at Green Africa Airways Limited
content:
Green Africa Airways Limited is a value airline based in Lagos, Nigeria. We are a new carrier that offers safe, reliable and affordable air travel to a much broader group of customers. This positions us as a significant contributor to the economic development of Nigeria and the African continent.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Flight Operations Auditor

Job Location: Lagos

Job role
     

            
    




	Ensure communication and coordination with operational gLeads in the management of operational risks
	Implement the requirements of Civil Aviation Regulations and all associated airworthiness requirements in flight operations
	identified through audits conducted on the organization are corrected within the stipulated time
	Advising flight operations department on the best ways to fulfill the requirements of the Authority and industry best practice
	Communicate regularly with operational gLeads within the organization, subcontracted organization and suppliers on the requirements and implementation of the quality management system and safety management system desired goals
	Monitor flight operations organization’s compliance with Civil Aviation Regulations
	Implement Quality Audit Program to meet company goals and regulatory authority requirements
	Administer the program and establishing a follow up system for discrepancies observed during audit activities
	Collect and analyze operational flight data and reports to identify needed improvement in training, IOCC and crew performance
	Monitor dispatch, flight crew and cabin crew for currency of medicals, licenses, competency and simulator training currency
	Monitor flight & duty periods for flight dispatchers, flight crew and cabin crew to check to ensure crew operate within regulatory limits and manage fatigue risk
	Monitor flight operations sub-contractors and suppli.


Qualifications


	Must be a holder of a Diploma or Degree in Aerospace or Aeronautical Engineering; or must have held a Cabin Crew license or must have held a Flight Dispatcher license or must have held a Commercial Pilot License
	Must be conversant with Nigeria Civil Aviation Authority Requirement and organizational requirements and procedures
	Must have worked in a commercial or private airline for at least 3 years
	Must hold an Auditor qualification.


Click here to apply online

 

2.)  ATR 72- 500/600 (Type Rated) Captain

Job Location: Lagos

Job role


	We are looking for experienced Captains to join our exciting and rapidly expanding Flight Operations team.
	As a value airline, Green Africa is always looking for ways to safely offer affordable fares to our customers.
	Our Captains will be frontline players responsible for a safe and efficient operation that will allow us to consistently and profitably deliver on this critical mission. 
	The Captain acts as the commander of the aircraft during all normal and abnormal situations so that safety is maintained at the highest possible level.
	The Captain will also set, maintain and demonstrate high professional standards in all aspects of their position and act as the brand ambassador so that the corporate image of Green Africa is upheld at all times.
	The Captain is responsible for the safety of the aircraft, crew, passengers, and cargo at all times while in command of the aircraft and maintaining an efficient operation.


Qualifications


	Hold an ICAO ATPL with the ATR 72-500/600 type rating
	First class medical certificate
	ICAO level 5 English or above
	A minimum of 6000 total flying hours
	At least 2000 airline command hours on the ATR 500/600 series
	Must have flown within the last 12 months.


Click here to apply online

title: Job Vacancies at Adexen Recruitment Agency
content:
Adexen is a global Human Ressources Company providing business and support services in Africa. We support companies in all industries in the fields of HR, Legal, Finance, Sales & Marketing, Engineering and Supply chain.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Construction Manager, Marine Works - Expatriate

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Reporting to the Project Manager, the Construction Manager is responsible for the day-to-day execution of construction activities on site, ensuring that works are carried out safely, efficiently and in accordance with approved plans, schedules, quality standards and HSE requirements.
	The role is strongly site-based, with a focus on construction delivery, supervision and coordination of marine and civil works.


Construction Execution and Site Management:


	Supervise all on-site construction activities related to marine works, civil works, dredging and port structures
	Ensure works are executed in accordance with approved drawings, method statements and technical specifications
	Coordinate daily and weekly construction activities to meet project milestones and schedules
	Identify site constraints and propose practical solutions to maintain productivity.


Supervision of Contractors and Subcontractors:


	Coordinate and supervise subcontractors, suppliers and site teams across all work fronts
	Monitor manpower, equipment, productivity and performance on site
	Ensure proper sequencing of works and effective interface management between trades.


HSE, Quality and Compliance:


	Enforce compliance with HSE rules, procedures and site safety plans
	Ensure construction activities comply with quality requirements, inspection and test plans and international standards
	Participate in site inspections, audits and toolbox talks
	Report incidents, non-conformities and corrective actions to the Project Manager.


Planning, Reporting and Coordination:


	Support short-term planning, look-ahead schedules and progress tracking
	Prepare daily and weekly site reports covering progress, manpower, equipment and issues
	Coordinate closely with engineering, planning, quality and HSE teams


Interface and Site Coordination:


	Manage on-site interfaces between marine works, civil works, dredging operations and logistics
	Coordinate with port authorities, local stakeholders and site representatives for daily operations
	Ensure permits, access and work areas are properly managed to avoid delays.


Desired Skills and Experience


	Degree in Civil Engineering, Marine Engineering or Construction Management.
	7–12 years of experience in construction management on marine, port or coastal infrastructure projects.
	Hands-on experience in site execution of port structures, quay walls, marine foundations and dredging works.
	Proven ability to manage subcontractors and multicultural site teams.
	Strong understanding of construction methodologies, sequencing and site logistics.
	Strong safety awareness and experience working under strict HSE frameworks.
	Experience in Africa or emerging markets is a strong advantage.


Click here to apply online

Note: We thank all applicants however only those selected will be contacted.

 

2.) Yard Manager, Marine Works - Expatriate

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full time

Responsibilities


	The Yard Manager will manage day-to-day yard operations supporting construction and marine works.
	He will ensure safe, efficient and orderly management of materials, equipment, laydown areas and internal logistics.
	He will support construction activities by ensuring materials and equipment availability in line with site schedules.


Yard Operations, Assets and Infrastructure Management:


	Manage day-to-day yard operations supporting marine and port construction activities.
	Oversee the operation and maintenance coordination of concrete batching plants, cranes and heavy construction equipment.
	Ensure optimal availability and utilization of construction assets in line with site requirements.
	Organize yard layouts, laydown areas and circulation plans to support efficient operations.


Equipment, Machinery and Workforce Coordination:


	Coordinate the deployment and scheduling of cranes, lifting equipment and construction machinery.
	Manage large operational teams, including shift-based organizations of up to 600 personnel.
	Ensure effective manpower planning, task allocation and supervision across day and night shifts.
	Coordinate closely with construction and marine teams to align resources with work fronts.


Material Reception, Storage and Internal Logistics:


	Supervise the reception, inspection, identification and storage of construction materials.
	Control material movements within the yard to ensure timely supply to construction areas.
	Ensure proper storage conditions, traceability and protection of materials and equipment.
	Interface with logistics, procurement and transport teams to manage inbound and outbound flows.


HSE, Yard Security and Compliance:


	Enforce strict compliance with HSE rules, lifting procedures and traffic management plans within the yard.
	Ensure yard security, access control and safe circulation of personnel, vehicles and equipment.
	Manage risk prevention measures related to heavy equipment, lifting operations and high-density manpower.
	Report incidents, near-misses, damages and corrective actions to the Construction Manager.


Planning, Reporting and Interface Management:


	Align yard operations with construction schedules and marine operations.
	Prepare daily and weekly reports on manpower, equipment utilization, production and yard activities.
	Coordinate yard interfaces with port authorities, subcontractors and logistics providers.
	Anticipate operational constraints and propose solutions to avoid delays or disruptions.


Desired Skills and Experience


	Diploma or degree in Construction Management, Logistics, Civil Engineering or related field.
	5–10 years of experience in yard management, site logistics or construction support roles on large infrastructure or marine projects.
	Strong understanding of construction site logistics, material handling and equipment management.
	Experience working in port or marine construction environments is a strong advantage.
	Strong safety awareness and experience enforcing HSE rules on site.
	Ability to coordinate multiple interfaces in a fast-paced construction environment.


Click here to apply online

Note: We thank all applicants however only those selected will be contacted.

 

 

3.) Project Manager, Marine Works - Expatriate

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full time

Responsibilities


	This is a high-visibility, complex and fast-moving port reconstruction program, at the heart of Nigeria’s trade, logistics and economic growth.
	We are looking for a seasoned Project Manager with a strong background in marine works and port infrastructure, capable of taking full ownership of a large, multidisciplinary construction project in a demanding operating environment.


Your Mission


	You will have overall responsibility for the successful delivery of the port rehabilitation works, from mobilization to handover, ensuring that the project is delivered safely, on time, within budget and to international quality standards.


Project Leadership & Delivery:


	Take full ownership of project execution, from detailed planning through construction and commissioning.
	Define and control project schedules, budgets and resource plans in line with contractual and client objectives.
	Anticipate risks, constraints and interface issues and put in place proactive mitigation plans.
	Ensure smooth coordination between marine works, civil works, dredging, structures, equipment and logistics.


Site & Team Management:


	Lead and coordinate a large, multicultural team of engineers, supervisors, contractors and subcontractors.
	Establish a strong site culture based on safety, performance, accountability and collaboration.
	Drive productivity, discipline and technical excellence across all work packages.


Stakeholder & Client Interface:


	Act as the main interface with the client, port authority, government agencies and consultants.
	Manage communications, reporting and project governance at senior level.
	Handle claims, variations and negotiations in close cooperation with commercial teams.


Financial & Contractual Control:


	Control project costs, cash flow and forecasts.
	Monitor contract performance, variations, claims and risk exposure.
	Ensure profitability while maintaining strong client relationships.


Quality, HSE & Compliance:


	Enforce international standards for marine construction, port infrastructure and HSE.
	Ensure full compliance with Nigerian regulations, environmental requirements and contractual obligations.
	Deliver a port facility that meets international performance and durability standards.


Desired Skills and Experience


	You are a senior marine construction professional who has already managed complex port or maritime infrastructure projects in challenging environments
	A degree in Civil Engineering, Marine Engineering or Construction Management (Master’s is a plus).
	10+ years of experience managing large-scale marine, port or coastal infrastructure projects.
	A strong track record in Africa or other emerging markets.
	Solid technical knowledge of port structures, dredging, quay walls, marine foundations and coastal works.
	Strong leadership, negotiation and stakeholder management skills.
	Fluency with planning and control tools (Primavera P6, MS Project, etc.).
	PMP or similar certification is an advantage.


Click here to apply online

Note: We thank all applicants however only those selected will be contacted.

	Support crisis management and organizational change initiatives.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s degree is an advantage)
	Minimum of 10 years of post-NYSC experience, with at least 8 years in HR management
	At least 3 years in a senior leadership role
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian and international labor laws
	Proven experience in policy development and organizational development
	Oil & Gas upstream experience is an added advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Izabelle@5cee.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
